title: EnglishPod 初级 英文播客 0051

segments.en: And today we're bringing you another great lesson and this time we're going to be shopping.
segments.cn: 今天我们带来另一个精彩的课程，这次我们要去购物。

segments.en: Actually a lot of our users asked for some lessons about shopping, right?
segments.cn: 实际上，我们很多用户要求一些关于购物的课程，对吗？

segments.en: And I think one of the most important things when you go shopping is to get a good price.
segments.cn: 我认为购物时最重要的事情之一就是获得一个好价格。

segments.en: So we're going to be teaching you how to bargain.
segments.cn: 所以我们将教你如何讨价还价。

segments.en: So Marco, you just mentioned a really great word.
segments.cn: Marco，你刚提到一个很好的词。

segments.en: Let's look at it in Vocabulary Preview.
segments.cn: 让我们在词汇预览中看看它。

segments.en: Alright, so we're going to preview the word bargain today.
segments.cn: 好的，今天我们将预览“讨价还价”这个词。

segments.en: Now this is an interesting word because it's a verb and a noun.
segments.cn: 这是一个有趣的词，因为它既是动词也是名词。

segments.en: So a bargain is a good price, right?
segments.cn: 所以，讨价还价是一个好价格，对吗？

segments.en: Okay, so a bargain is a good price.
segments.cn: 好的，所以讨价还价是一个好价格。

segments.en: Yeah, this t-shirt was a bargain.
segments.cn: 是的，这件T恤是个便宜货。

segments.en: I only paid a dollar for it.
Okay, so that is a bargain.
But to bargain as a verb.
To try and get a good price.
So it's very similar to negotiate.
segments.cn: 所以这与谈判非常相似。

segments.en: Yeah, so I would say it costs a hundred dollars.
segments.cn: 是的，我会说它要一百美元。

segments.en: And then I would say maybe no, I'll give you fifty.
segments.cn: 然后我会说，也许不，我给你五十。

segments.en: Okay, so we're going to be bargaining.
segments.cn: 好的，所以我们将进行讨价还价。

segments.en: Let's listen to the dialogue for the first time as we have a woman bargaining in a store, right?
segments.cn: 让我们第一次听对话，看看一位女性在商店里讨价还价，对吗？

segments.en: Yeah, this dress is really nice.
That one is a hundred fifty dollars.
What about this other one over here?
Um, that's a bit out of my price range.
Can you give me a better deal?
segments.cn: 你能给我一个更好的价格吗？

segments.en: This is an exclusive design by Damarco.
It's a bargain at that price.
That's still more than I wanted to spend.
segments.cn: 这仍然超出了我想花的钱。

segments.en: What if I take both dresses?
Okay, I can give you a special discount just because you seem like a nice person.
segments.cn: 好吧，我可以给你一个特别折扣，因为你看起来是个好人。

segments.en: A hundred and ninety for both.
That's two for the price of one and that's my last offer.
segments.cn: 这是两件的价格，且这是我的最后报价。

segments.en: Alright, that was some good bargaining skills right there.
segments.cn: 好的，那是一些很好的讨价还价技巧。

segments.en: She used a lot of good language to get a cheaper price, didn't she?
segments.cn: 她使用了很多好的语言来获得更便宜的价格，不是吗？

segments.en: So, let's take a look at this language in Language Takeaway.
segments.cn: 所以，让我们在语言收获中看看这些语言。

segments.en: Okay, the first word we have in Language Takeaway today.
segments.cn: 好的，今天语言收获中的第一个词。

segments.en: So, price range is the minimum and the maximum that you're willing to spend for a thing that you want to buy.
segments.cn: 所以，价格范围是你愿意为想买的东西花费的最低和最高金额。

segments.en: So, in the dialogue we heard, it's out of my price range.
segments.cn: 所以，在对话中我们听到，它超出了我的价格范围。

segments.en: It's more than I can spend.
Let's look at our next word.
So, she said, I think I'll shop around.
segments.cn: 所以，她说，我想我会四处购物。

segments.en: So, she wants to check in a few other stores to see if there's a better price.
segments.cn: 所以，她想去其他几家商店看看是否有更好的价格。

segments.en: If I shop around, I'm going and trying to compare prices maybe.
segments.cn: 如果我四处购物，我会去比较价格。

segments.en: This is a really good shopping technique.
segments.cn: 这是一种很好的购物技巧。

segments.en: Okay, and let's look at our last word.
segments.cn: 好的，让我们看看最后一个词。

segments.en: So, something that's pricey is... Expensive.
segments.cn: 所以，昂贵的东西就是……贵。

segments.en: This is a more sort of informal way of saying expensive.
segments.cn: 这是一种更非正式的说法。

segments.en: So, instead of saying, wow, that car is really expensive.
segments.cn: 所以，不是说，哇，那辆车真贵。

segments.en: Okay, let's listen to our dialogue for the second time and it's going to be slowed down a bit.
segments.cn: 好的，让我们第二次听我们的对话，速度会慢一点。

segments.en: So, you'll understand some of these great words a little bit better.
segments.cn: 这样你会更好地理解一些很棒的词汇。

segments.en: What about this other one over here?
Hmm, that's a bit out of my price range.
Can you give me a better deal?
segments.cn: 你能给我更好的交易吗？

segments.en: This is an exclusive design by Damarco.
It's a bargain at that price.
segments.cn: 这个价格真是个便宜货。

segments.en: That's still more than I wanted to spend.
segments.cn: 这仍然超出了我想花的钱。

segments.en: What if I take both dresses?
Okay, I can give you a special discount just because you seem like a nice person.
segments.cn: 好吧，我可以给你一个特别折扣，因为你看起来是个好人。

segments.en: That's two for the price of one.
segments.cn: 这就是一件的价格买两件。

segments.en: So, we've covered the language in this dialogue.
segments.cn: 所以，我们在这个对话中涵盖了语言。

segments.en: Now, let's take a look at some of the phrases in Putting It Together.
segments.cn: 现在，让我们看看“整合”中的一些短语。

segments.en: So, Marco, in this dialogue, there's a lot of really useful phrases to help you get a better price when you shop, right?
segments.cn: 所以，Marco，在这个对话中，有很多非常有用的短语可以帮助你在购物时获得更好的价格，对吧？

segments.en: So, the first one we have is, can you give me a better deal?
segments.cn: 所以，我们第一个短语是，你能给我更好的交易吗？

segments.en: So, if I'm shopping and something is too expensive, I would use this sentence with the shopkeeper.
segments.cn: 所以，如果我在购物，某样东西太贵了，我会用这句话对店主说。

segments.en: So, you might say, hey, this is out of my price range.
segments.cn: 所以，你可能会说，嘿，这超出了我的预算。

segments.en: Could you give me a better deal?
segments.cn: 你能给我更好的交易吗？

segments.en: Okay, we have some examples of can you give me a better deal.
segments.cn: 好的，我们有一些“你能给我更好的交易吗”的例子。

segments.en: I really like this shirt, but it's too expensive.
segments.cn: 我真的很喜欢这件衬衫，但它太贵了。

segments.en: Can you give me a better deal?
segments.cn: 你能给我更好的交易吗？

segments.en: Can you give me a better price on this car?
segments.cn: 你能给我这辆车更好的价格吗？

segments.en: I really don't have that much money.
So, you can see here that you can say, can you give me a better deal?
segments.cn: 所以，你可以看到这里你可以说，你能给我更好的交易吗？

segments.en: Or, can you give me a better price?
segments.cn: 或者，你能给我更好的价格吗？

segments.en: Alright, let's take a look at the next phrase.
segments.cn: 好吧，让我们看看下一个短语。

segments.en: That's still more than I wanted to spend.
segments.cn: 这仍然超出了我想花的钱。

segments.en: That's still more than I wanted to spend.
segments.cn: 这仍然超出了我想花的钱。

segments.en: That's still more than I wanted to spend.
segments.cn: 这仍然超出了我想花的钱。

segments.en: So, if the seller suggests a really high price, you can say, that's still more than I wanted to spend.
segments.cn: 所以，如果卖家建议一个非常高的价格，你可以说，这仍然超出了我想花的钱。

segments.en: So, basically you're telling the shopkeeper, it's still too expensive.
segments.cn: 所以，基本上你是在告诉店主，这仍然太贵了。

segments.en: You still don't want to spend that much.
Alright, let's take a look at our last phrase.
segments.cn: 好吧，让我们看看最后一个短语。

segments.en: Now, this could work both ways.
It could be the shopkeeper that's telling you that.
Right, or you could say, that's my last offer.
segments.cn: 对，或者你可以说，这是我的最后报价。

segments.en: That's my highest price if you are buying it.
segments.cn: 如果你在买它，那就是我的最高价格。

segments.en: Right, because sometimes when you're bargaining, the shopkeeper will say, alright, what's your best offer?
segments.cn: 对，因为有时当你在讨价还价时，店主会问，好的，你的最佳报价是什么？

segments.en: Alright, so we've looked at a lot of great phrases and words and now you're ready to bargain and also listen to this dialogue for the third time.
segments.cn: 好吧，所以我们看了很多很棒的短语和词汇，现在你准备好讨价还价了，也可以第三次听这个对话。

segments.en: And then we'll come back and talk some more.
Yeah, this dress is really nice.
What about this other one over here?
Um, that's a bit out of my price range.
Can you give me a better deal?
segments.cn: 你能给我更好的交易吗？

segments.en: This is an exclusive design by Damarco.
It's a bargain at that price.
segments.cn: 这个价格真是个便宜货。

segments.en: That's still more than I wanted to spend.
segments.cn: 这仍然超出了我想花的钱。

segments.en: What if I take both dresses?
Okay, I can give you a special discount just because you seem like a nice person.
segments.cn: 好吧，我可以给你一个特别折扣，因为你看起来是个好人。

segments.en: That's two for the price of one and that's my last offer.
segments.cn: 这是一件的价格买两件，这是我的最后报价。

segments.en: Alright, so I know that in Canada it's not really common to bargain, right?
segments.cn: 好吧，我知道在加拿大讨价还价并不常见，对吧？

segments.en: Even when you go to the market to buy fruits and vegetables, it's very, very rare to bargain with a shopkeeper.
segments.cn: 即使你去市场买水果和蔬菜，和店主讨价还价也是非常非常罕见的。

segments.en: No, in Ecuador you definitely bargain.
segments.cn: 不，在厄瓜多尔你绝对会讨价还价。

segments.en: Well, if you go to the mall, for example, or if you go to a supermarket, of course you wouldn't really bargain.
segments.cn: 嗯，如果你去购物中心，比如说，或者去超市，当然你不会真的讨价还价。

segments.en: Unless maybe you go to a small store or you go to one of the local markets, then it's more common to bargain.
segments.cn: 除非你去小商店或者当地市场，那样讨价还价就更常见了。

segments.en: And you have to because people expect you to bargain.
segments.cn: 而且你必须这样做，因为人们期待你讨价还价。

segments.en: Yeah, in many countries in the world, bargaining is almost like an art.
segments.cn: 是的，在世界上许多国家，讨价还价几乎是一种艺术。

segments.en: Actually, Marco, you are an excellent bargainer, aren't you?
segments.cn: 其实，马尔科，你是个优秀的讨价还价者，不是吗？

segments.en: Yeah, I've been known to bargain with the shopkeepers.
segments.cn: 是的，我在和店主讨价还价方面是有名的。

segments.en: I've been known to bargain a little bit with the shopkeepers and helping out.
segments.cn: 我在和店主讨价还价方面有点名气，并且帮助他们。

segments.en: I mean, you've got better prices than I can even imagine getting.
segments.cn: 我的意思是，你得到的价格比我能想象的还要好。

segments.en: Maybe we'll get JP to go to our comments section and tell you about that.
segments.cn: 也许我们会让JP去我们的评论区告诉你。

segments.en: So we want to know about your countries.
segments.cn: 所以我们想知道你们国家的情况。

segments.en: Tell us about your country's bargaining customs.
segments.cn: 告诉我们你们国家的讨价还价习俗。

segments.en: And also leave your questions there for us.
segments.cn: 也请在那儿留下你的问题。

segments.en: We'll be there to answer them.
segments.cn: 我们会在那里回答它们。

segments.en: But until then, we've got to go.
segments.cn: 但在那之前，我们得走了。
